item.title: Tiana add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "All endings are also beginnings. We just don't know it at the time." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is a curious thing, the death of a loved one. We all know that our time in this world is limited, and that eventually all of us will end up underneath some sheet, never to wake up. And yet it is always a surprise when it happens to someone we know. It is like walking up the stairs to your bedroom in the dark, and thinking there is one more stair than there is. Your foot falls down, through the air, and there is a sickly moment of dark surprise as you try and readjust the way you thought of things." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "But there are times in this harum-scarum world when figuring out the right thing to do is quite simple, but doing the right thing is simply impossible...." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is useless for me to describe to you how terrible Violet, Klaus, and even Sunny felt in the time that followed. If you have ever lost someone very important to you, then you already know how it feels, and if you haven't, you cannot possibly imagine it." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Tiana add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Today you are You, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is Youer than You." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, Nothing is going to get better. It's not." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "So be sure when you step, Step with care and great tact. And remember that life's A Great Balancing Act. And will you succeed? Yes! You will, indeed! (98 and Â¾ percent guaranteed) Kid, you'll move mountains." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Tiana add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Make it a rule never to give a child a book you would not read yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Tiana add a quote by AnaÃ¯s Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- AnaÃ¯s Nin

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "Scar tissue is stronger than regular tissue. Realize the strength, move on." -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Tiana add a quote by AnaÃ¯s Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naÃ¯ve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- AnaÃ¯s Nin

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Cheris Kramarae
item.description: "Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings." -- Cheris Kramarae

item.title: Tiana add a quote by zadie smith
item.description: "She wore her sexuality with an older woman's ease, and not like an awkward purse, never knowing how to hold it, where to hang it, or when to just put it down." -- zadie smith

item.title: Tiana add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I hope she'll be a fool -- that's the best thing a girl can be in this world, a beautiful little fool." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "Right. I look fine. Except I don't,' said Zora, tugging sadly at her man's nightshirt. This was why Kiki had dreaded having girls: she knew she wouldn't be able to protect them from self-disgust. To that end she had tried banning television in the early years, and never had a lipstick or a woman's magazine crossed the threshold of the Belsey home to Kiki's knowledge, but these and other precautionary measures had made no difference. It was in the air, or so it seemed to Kiki, this hatred of women and their bodies-- it seeped in with every draught in the house; people brought it home on their shoes, they breathed it in off their newspapers. There was no way to control it." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "Any woman who counts on her face is a fool." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "The beautiful is as useful as the useful." He added after a momentâs silence, "Perhaps more so." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Tiana add a quote by Anna Louise Strong
item.description: "To fall in love is easy, even to remain in it is not difficult; our human loneliness is cause enough. But it is a hard quest worth making to find a comrade through whose steady presence one becomes steadily the person one desires to be." -- Anna Louise Strong
